intro: Lappula redowskii var. pilosum, commonly known as the hairy lappula, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its small, greenish-yellow flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its seed pods are elongated and contain small, rounded seeds. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptability.
